bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exemption for general partner in limited partnership

bcl:definition.bcl:text: foreign limited partner means a limited partner that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: holds an interest in the limited partnership in trust for a foreign entity;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: general partner has the same meaning as in Part 3 of the Partnership Act;
limited partner has the same meaning as in Part 3 of the Partnership Act;
limited partnership means a limited partnership

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: formed under section 51 of the Partnership Act, or
registered under section 80 of the Partnership Act;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: profit includes compensation in the form of income on contributions made by limited partners;
taxation year has the same meaning as in section 249 (1) of the Income Tax Act (Canada).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A transferee who is a general partner in a limited partnership is exempt from the obligation to pay tax under section 2.02 (3) (a) of the Act with respect to the transferee's proportionate share of a taxable transaction's fair market value if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the transferee is acquiring the land that is the subject of the taxable transaction on behalf of the limited partnership, and
all of the following conditions are met with respect to the limited partnership:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: on the date on which the application for registration of the taxable transaction is made at a land title office,

bcl:clause.bcl:text: each general partner is a Canadian citizen, a permanent resident of Canada or a corporation other than a foreign corporation, and
the combined interest in the limited partnership of all foreign limited partners accounts for less than half of the entitlement of all partners to share in the profits of the limited partnership;

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: each general partner and limited partner is a resident of Canada for income tax purposes throughout the taxation year in which the taxable transaction occurs.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An application for an exemption under this section must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: be in the form required by the administrator, and

include a consent, in the form required by the administrator, by which the transferee consents to the administrator conducting inquiries that the administrator considers necessary to confirm that the transferee qualifies for the exemption.
